Title: Boy Scouts are expected to address gay ban
Summary: IRVING, Texas — Boy Scouts of America officials are expected to announce Wednesday whether they will lift a national ban on gay leaders and members, instead giving local scouting groups the power to decide.

Title: Boy Scouts Delay Decision on Admitting Gays
Summary: The Boy Scouts of America's national executive board has delayed a decision on whether to lift its longstanding ban on gay scouts and leaders.

Title: Boy Scouts delay decision on gay membership
Summary: The Boy Scouts of America said Wednesday it needed 'more time for a deliberate review' of its policy banning gay Scouts and leaders.

Title: Boy Scouts Delay Decision on Gays
Summary: Boy Scouts delay decision on whether to lift ban on gay scouts and leaders

Title: Boy Scouts delay decision to lift ban on gay members
Boy Scouts leaders make announcement on gay ban
Summary: Organization issues statement while in spotlight for weighing end to ban on gay members, leaders

Title: Boy Scouts leaders push back decision on lifting gay ban
Summary: Organization issues statement while in spotlight for weighing end to ban on gay members, leaders

Title: Boy Scouts of America's Ban on Gays Intact, For Now
Summary: Organization will vote on lifting ban at annual meeting in May.

Title: Boy Scouts Postpone Decision on Gays
Summary: Boy Scouts of America, which earlier said it was reconsidering a ban on participation by gays, said on Wednesday it was delaying its decision on the matter until May.

Title: US Boy Scouts delays vote on gay ban
Summary: The national board of the Boy Scouts of America postpones a vote to end a ban on gay scouts and leaders, the youth group says.

Title: A letter-by-letter rundown of the Postal Service's new plan
Photos: LIFE.com's tribute to the postal service
Postal Service ending Saturday delivery
Summary: The move is the latest effort to cut costs after losing nearly $16 billion last year.

Title: Postal Service Plans to End Saturday Delivery
Summary: The Postal Service is planning to stop delivery of letters and other mail but will continue to handle packages, a move it said would save about $2 billion annually.

Title: Postal Service seeks to end Saturday mail delivery
Summary: The U.S. Postal Service, struggling under a financial load and facing tough competition, will stop delivering mail on Saturdays beginning this summer, officials announced.

Title: Postal Service to Cut Saturday Mail to Trim Costs
Summary: The U.S. Postal Service will stop delivering mail on Saturdays but continue to deliver packages six days a week under a plan aimed at saving about $2 billion, the financially struggling agency says.

Title: The Postal Service Should Cut More Than Saturday Delivery
Summary: If the USPS were a typical company, the mail would arrive far less frequently.

Title: U.S. Postal Service: Saturday letter delivery to end in August
Summary: Postmaster general says service - which lost $15.9B last year - not in financial position to continue same delivery schedule

Title: US Postal Service to End Saturday Mail Delivery
Ending Saturday Mail Only First Step: Postmaster General
Summary: "This is just one step in a plan to resolve our finances," the Postmaster General said in an interview on CNBC.

Title: Post office to end Saturday mail service
Summary: The Postal Service is planning to drop Saturday delivery of first-class mail, a congressional source said this morning.

Title: Postal Service seeks to end Saturday mail delivery
Summary: The U.S. Postal Service, struggling under a financial load and facing tough competition, will stop delivering mail on Saturdays beginning this summer, officials announced.

Title: Postal Service to Cut Saturday Mail to Trim Costs
Summary: The U.S. Postal Service will stop delivering mail on Saturdays but continue to deliver packages six days a week under a plan aimed at saving about $2 billion, the financially struggling agency says.

Title: US Postal Service to End Saturday Mail Delivery

Title: Library Book Returned 55 Years Late
Summary: A copy of 'Fire of Francis Xavier' was returned to the New York Public Library.

Title: Library receives book 55 years overdue
Summary: A New York public library received a book in the mail that had been checked out for 55 years, as librarians told followers on Facebook they were 'not sure what the late charge should be.'

Title: That's a late fee: Library book returned after 55 years
Summary: The library's current late fee for hardcover books is 25 cents per day.

Title: Photos:  Alabama Hostage Standoff
Summary: Kidnapper Jimmy Lee Dykes exchanged gunfire with SWAT agents.

Title: Monopoly Fans Vote to Add Cat, Toss Iron Tokens
Summary: Scottie dog has a new nemesis in Monopoly after fans voted in an online contest to add a cat token to the property trading game, replacing the iron, toy maker Hasbro Inc. announced Wednesday.

Title: Northeast braces for possible winter 'blockbuster'
Summary: A winter storm heading for the Northeast could bring major snowfall to upstate New York and New England on Friday and into the weekend – but forecasts are divided on its potential impact.

Title: Ala. Hostage Taker Planted Bombs in Bunker, FBI Says
Summary: Jimmy Lee Dykes, the man who held a 5-year-old boy hostage for nearly a week in an underground bunker in Alabama, had two homemade explosive devices on his property and engaged in a fire fight with SWAT agents before they stormed the bunker, according to the FBI.

Title: Leading Tunisian Opposition Figure Is Fatally Shot
Summary: Thousands of protesters gathered on Wednesday in the capital city of Tunis after Chokri Belaid, a critic of the Islamist-led government, was killed by gunmen outside his home.

Title: Deadly tsunami hits Solomon Islands
Summary: Several deaths likely, dozens of homes damaged, officials say; Powerful 8.0 quake below South Pacific floor generated the five-foot wave

Title: Tsunami hits Solomon Islands reportedly killing 5
